qas.question: On what date was India's Supreme Court established?
What article of India's Constitution makes decisions by their Supreme Court binding on lower courts?
India's Supreme Court has ultimate power to determine interpretations of what?
When the Supreme Court ensures that lower courts have properly applied the law it is called what?
In addition to national laws, India's Supreme Court may also interpret what regulations?
What was adopted after the creation of the Supreme Court of India?

plausible_answers.text: the law declared by Supreme Court is to be binding on all Courts within the territory of India

qas.question: What does Article 414 of the Constitution of India say?

plausible_answers.text: to ensure the application of the rule of law

qas.question: Why is the Supreme Court vested with the power of judicial authority?

context: In India, the <b5_0>Supreme Court of India<b5_0/> was created on <a0_0>January 28, 1950<a0_0/> after adoption of <b6_0>the Constitution<b6_0/>. <a1_0>Article 141<a1_0/> of the Constitution of India states that <b7_0>the law declared by Supreme Court is to be binding on all Courts within the territory of India<b7_0/>. It is the highest court in India and has ultimate judicial authority to interpret <a2_0>the Constitution<a2_0/> and decide questions of national law (including <a4_0>local bylaws<a4_0/>). The Supreme Court is also vested with the power of <a3_0>judicial review<a3_0/> <b8_0>to ensure the application of the rule of law<b8_0/>.
